title: Tories urged to capture spirit of 1987 manifesto to secure election victory
text:
Boris Johnson has been urged by allies to take inspiration from the 1987 Conservative manifesto in order to stage a repeat of Margaret Thatcher’s landslide victory over Labour.

A senior cabinet minister said the Prime Minister should strip back the party’s policy programme to focus on Brexit and a small number of domestic priorities.

They added that a 1987-style manifesto would avoid succumbing to the same fate as Theresa May, who came unstuck in 2017 when her central message on Brexit was overshadowed by domestic policy blunders.

Mr Johnson told Tory activists last month that the manifesto would be a “short, concise outline with no hostages to fortune”, in an apparent swipe at his predecessor....
